text: the movement was catapulted into the headlines early august when the semiautonomous city which returned chinese rule almost two decades ago one thousand nine hundred and ninety-seven saw the first proindependence rally its history

hong kong baptist university protest contrite but undeterred suspended students look back hong kong baptist university mandarin saga andrew chan denies proindependence leanings while lau tszkei refuses apologise for angry protest which sparked weeks acrimony campus

published saturday three february two thousand and eighteen mandarin the language independence five apr two thousand and eighteen after weeks protests anger and even death threats over mandarin language exam baptist university campus seemed have calmed down the end this week when the school announced was lifting the suspensions two students after the pair apologised affected staff

speaking this week student union president lau tszkei and year five chinese medicine student andrew chan lokhang said their oneweek ban from attending classes and the public scrutiny during the row would not stop them fighting improve school policies
they were among about thirty students who stormed the school language centre january seventeen demand more transparency for exemption test introduced last year for compulsory mandarin module
week after the fracas the language centre the school launched investigation into lau and chan then suspended the pair before the probe was over
chan particular became public enemy for many mainlanders with hundreds death threats sent his facebook account and guangzhou hospital where was doing internship

expletiveladen posters insulting baptist university head put hong kong campuses but chan vehemently denied that claim saying was merely interested fighting for students rights and preserving cantonese
the other central figure the episode lau said accepted the criticism about how handled the initial protest and acknowledged could better
but would not apologise for the protest saying students voices need heard

saw university students taking part social movements and how universities are place where there the value common governance both teachers and students lau tszkei said his political awakening came two thousand and twelve when took part protest against compulsory national education for public schools intended strengthen national identity awareness and nurture patriotism towards china
